comm with black onion relish that's
right not only is this really delicious
and the perfect condiment for grilling

best thing you can do to a friend what's
the best help a move so the first thing
we're going to need is some very hot
coals mature coals alright you want them
white-hot and we're gonna take two small
yellow onions I guess they're not really
small there's just not the giant ones
we're gonna say like baseball-sized and
we're going to kind of nestle them down
into the coals and sort of partially
bury them you don't need to go all the
way over the top although I guess it
would be faster that way but I didn't
have that many coals so I just kind of
nestled the close up next to it and sort
of piled it up as high as I could around
it and that's really all you need to do
and by the way I found the piling up of
the coals kind of fun way more fun than
it looks because as I'm watching this
I'm thinking man that is not
scintillating video but anyway you're
going to pile up the coals like that
we're going to put the cover down and
we're going to roast that for 15 minutes
just like that and fifty minutes later
it looks like this and if you're
outdoors grilling with people they're
going to be saying what the hell are you
making and you'll be like black onion
relish what you think I was making so
yes those look completely charred and
burnt and ruined but they're not that's
only the outer layer of the onion
burning the inside is roasting and
getting all sweet and smoky and amazing
so do not be scared by the appearance it
could be very hideous on the outside yet
very nice and sweet in the inside like
some chefs I know alright so we're going
to flip those we're going to Ribery them
in the coals or partially Ribery to be
technically correct and then I gave mine
10 more minutes and I started checking
what you want to look for is you start
to bubble out of one of the ends that
means the liquid in the onion is
starting to boil and starts to leak out
so basically you can hear when these are
getting close you're going to hear that
bubbling you see those juices leaking
out if you want to double check with a
bamboo skewer you can do that they
shouldn't be soft they should just
barely barely beginning tender all right
and at that point when you decide your
onions are done you're going to pull
them out of the coals and put them in a
deep small bowl and quickly throw over a
plate and basically we're just going to
let those cool cover
and they're going to continue to cook
and steam from the residual heat and
those are going to be perfect so we're
going to set those aside covered alright
while those are cooling down I'm going
to go ahead and place a large red bell
pepper on the remaining coals and we're
going to fire roast that and you know
how to do this we've done this on the
stove on regular flame just put it down
and when the skin blackens and blisters
turn it until it's totally charred I'm
going to throw that in with my onions
put the plate back on and let that cool
completely alright so I actually
refrigerated mine because I had some
errands to run when I came back a couple
hours later they were ready to work with
so to finish the relish very simple
you're gonna peel off the black skin of
the onion it's going to come off super
easy let me just cut this in half so you
can see how amazing that is
look at that it's just perfectly roasted
all right so most of its going to be
very simple to clean but then you're
going to have those couple layers of
onion that were on the outside I don't
want you to discard those I want you to
clean those up because that's where a
lot of the smoky flavor is going to come
and those pieces are even sweeter so
long story short recover all usable
onion matter and of course I also scrape
the black skin off the red pepper and
now we're ready to chop now one word of
warning these are really really slippery
after you roast them like this so I
don't do any fancy cuts I just whack it
a few times that way whack it a few
times the other way and then just keep
chopping until it's as fine as I want so
I went for about the same texture as
you'd get with like a pickle relish so
I'm gonna do mine just about like that
I'm gonna do the same thing to the red
pepper and don't forget I'm always
trying to not block the camera with my
other hand so if it ever looks weird
that I'm cutting one-handed that's
probably the reason I know what I'm
doing I got skills
but sometimes I just cut it like this so
you can see what I'm doing instead of

and also I can't confirm or deny I did

weren't looking which sounds like
something I would do a big glug of olive
oil and then
definitely need some acid I'm using
sherry vinegar I've used lemon juice
I've used rice vinegar so many delicious
options balsamic yes so we're gonna give
that a very good mix and you could use
it right away but like all similar
recipes this definitely benefits by an
hour or two in the fridge so I
refrigerated mine until I needed it and
then I put it in a cute little ramekin
and it was pretty beautiful I think oh
yeah
cooking the onions in those coals really
does give it a very unique smoky
sweetness that's really hard to simulate
by simply roasting or caramelizing in a
pan now I'm sure you did not see a sad
ending coming for this video but I serve
this on some salmon and it was good it
was very good but it's not a hot dog and
every stupid bite I took of that salmon
I thought to myself man I wish this was
a hot dog how come this is not a hot dog
I really want this to be a hot dog and
it wasn't so you know what learned from
my mistake while this would be good at
any kind of grilled seafood or chicken
or pork or whatever I really think this
belongs on a giant hot dog slathered

high upon that would be fantastic so I
